roleset.name: acquiring, receiving, internalizing, bringing along, enacting

role.descr: taken FROM, SOURCE of thing taken

roles.note: WATCH OUT FOR LIGHT VERBISH NOMINALS-- these have their own roleset, take.28. Arg3 added for destination since the lack of that arg has been so problematic with the verb frame.

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: 2014, the 30-year anniversary of his taking the job

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: Another way to look at this problem is to consider how much medicine is in the patient's system just prior to his taking the pill.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT, take.01. Corresponds to VNcls bring-11.3, steal-10.5, hire-13.5.3.

roleset.name: tolerating

example.name: both args
example.text: Is Sanborn suggesting his taking abuse might prove him a “real man,” real enough to put on the bomb suit?

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.02. No VNcls.

roleset.name: causing (to be)

example.name: all args
example.text: John and Mary felt that their taking their relationship public via propbank was a great decision.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.03. Corresponds to VNcls convert-26.6.2

roleset.name: understanding to be

example.name: all args
example.text: Searle's submission to the work is indicated by his taking the painting,as it were,at its word: visual evidence is privileged positivistically.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.04. Corresponds to VNcls characterize-29.2.

roleset.name: needing, requiring

example.name: all args
example.text: John's taking an hour to finish his soup really pissed off Mary.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.10. Corresponds to VNcls fit-54.3, cost-54.2, require-103.

roleset.name: fixed phrase: taking place

example.name: both args
example.text: That is, where a do compound affirms the event's taking place, a modal compound affirms the conditions of potentiality governing the event's taking place.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.14. No VNcls.

roleset.name: writing off, acknowledge a financial loss

example.name: all args
example.text: In anticipation of his taking a loss on the sale of his house, he also negotiated the addition of a signing bonus of $20k (despite being unemployed).
example.arg: on the sale of his house

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.15. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking by surprise (or some other manner)

role.descr: surprise (or other manner, such as "by storm")

example.name: all args
example.text: Josephus has five episodes of conflict with the Tiberians in the Life, none of which involves his taking the city by storm.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.16. No VNcls.

roleset.name: becoming fond of

example.name: both args
example.text: ...and had he not been a man of inflexible morals and regular habits, there would have been a great danger of his taking to politics, or drinking,—both which pernicious vices we daily see men driven to by mere spleen and idleness.
example.arg: to politics, or drinking, -- both which pernicious vices we daily see men driven to by mere spleen and idleness

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.17. No VNcls.

roleset.name: swindling/robbing someone of something

example.name: all args
example.text: Mary's taking John for all he was worth in poker completely bankrupted him.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.25. No VNcls.

roleset.name: nominal version of light verb

role.descr: taker, subject of ligh verbish noun

roles.note: This roleset should only be used for cases where 'taking' acts as a light verb and the object of 'taking' is also an eventive, predicating noun. Use argMs for all other arguments-- these cannot be predicted because they are related to the true predicate rather than 'taking'.

example.name: both args
example.text: There are two very amusing Grant scenes: his taking a bath in his suit and playing an orange-under-the-jaw game in a nightclub.

roleset.note: Added by Julia to accommodate Light verb usages in nominalized form. Corresponds to the .LV frame in verbs. Compare to 'making.02'. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_away: removing

example.name: all args
example.text: Having already killed his wife and sons out of fear of their taking away his power, he has no remorse in ordering all newborn males in Bethlehem killed

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.05. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_in: giving shelter

example.name: both args
example.text: You can debate the wisdom of his taking in strays all you want, he won't change that.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.06. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_in: enjoying sensory input (esp viewing)

example.name: both args
example.text: Additionally, there are several San Francisco Hotels close to the vicinity of Fisherman’s Wharf where tourists can stay after their taking in the sights.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.23. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_off: removing

example.name: both args
example.text: On one day in August, Day fired off 11 messages, known as tweets, covering such issues as a gate agent's cranky behavior, Southwest job openings and a passenger's in-flight meltdown that led to his taking off his clothes.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.07. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_off: increase dramatically

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 that is taking off

roles.note: Arg2 added due to expected usage. Ideally, the verb frame should have this as well.

example.name: both args
example.text: Gold's taking off in price came as a shock to the prospector

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.08. No VNcls, but see calibratable_cos-45.6.

roleset.name: taking_off: taking time off for vacation, etc

role.descr: activity taken a break from (work, etc)

example.name: all args
example.text: Daniel and I were discussing his taking a week off from work to drive me up there.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.18. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_off: like a plane

example.name: both args
example.text: This video is of their taking off from Grimes Field starting at 7:00 am with one plane taking off every 90 seconds.
example.arg: with one plane taking off every 90 seconds

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.19. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_on: acquiring, hiring, undertaking

example.name: arg1 as an undertaking
example.text: In exchange for their taking on that work, the rest of us need to trust that our colleagues are working diligently on our behalf.

example.name: arg1 animate
example.text: Despite the concern of their lawyers and accountants about their taking on new partners, they developed a plan to open a dozen food businesses under the same brand utilizing committed, passionate business partners that upheld the same ideals of community involvement.

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: There may not have been any choice in their taking on these duties.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.09. Corresponds to VNcls adopt-93.

roleset.name: taking_on: facing in battle

example.name: both args
example.text: Much of Hollywood was sceptical at their taking on such a Goliath, but they won and Simmons was able to star at MGM in Young Bess (1953) with Granger, Charles Laughton and Deborah Kerr supporting the radiant star.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.21. Corresponds to VNcls confront-98.

roleset.name: taking_out: obtaining, drawing out

example.name: both args
example.text: In this decision, we hold that Colonel Wexler's employing agency must reimburse him for expenses he incurred in taking out that loan, since the expenses are similar in kind and amount to those for which reimbursement is specifically made appropriate by the Federal Travel Regulation (FTR).

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.11. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_out: directing neg emotion towards someone (unfairly)

role.descr: often "it", emotion being directed at arg2

example.name: all args
example.text: I hope you can figure out a way to provide your children with whatever your mom wasn’t able to provide you, and help your DH overcome his taking out his rage on the kids.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.26. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_out: killing

example.name: both args
example.text: Obama will be remembered for his taking out Bin Laden, Awlaki, decimating and crushing Al-Qaida.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.27. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_over: becoming dominant, in charge

roles.note: Arg2 added due to expected occurance

example.name: args 0, 2
example.text: Vanderbilt interim head coach Robbie Caldwell talks about his taking over for Bobby Johnson.

example.name: Strange steed...
example.text: The Anniversary Of His Taking Over The Reins Of The World's Fifth-biggest G
example.arg: the reins of the world's fifth-biggest G

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.12. Corresponds to VNcls adopt-93.

roleset.name: taking up: occupying space

role.descr: specific thing arg0 is using to take up space (if separate)

roles.note: arg2 is a different arg2 from the verb frame, which was trying to accommodate separate senses that take separate syntax. This arg2 is more like the theme arg seen in the spatial configuration VNcls (although this frame does not correspond to that VNcls fully).

example.name: all args
example.text: I've come far since then (1 year August since my RAI) & generally feel well, so I hope you don't mind my taking up space with post-trauma thyroid issues.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on one aspect of take.13. No VNcls.

predicate.note: Need additional roleset to break up unrelated senses in verb frame. (initiating some kind of contact)

roleset.name: taking_aback: surprising, offensively

roles.note: This one is probably quite rare and somewhat awkward, and will necessarily have an extra arg compared to the current verb frame to even work.

example.name: both args
example.text: I was so out of control by his taking me aback that I didn't know what to do – to laugh from hysteria,

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.20. No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_down: destroying, bringin an end to, defeating

example.name: both args
example.text: As he stood on the rooftop studying the darkened windows of the strip joint across from him, Dick noticed that sometime between his taking down the dark stranger and reaching the corner of Water Street and Shoreline Drive, the drenching rain had stopped.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based loosely on take.22 (although here we should try to use "DIR" with down using take.01 when possible, and use this frame for the more finite 'defeat', 'end' sense). No VNcls.

roleset.name: taking_hold: grabbing, physically or abstractly

example.name: physical grabbing
example.text: When appellee took hold of the short rope, he only assumed the risk incident to his taking hold of a rope of similar size and appearance.
example.arg: of a rope of similar size and appearance

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on take.24. No VNcls.
